entries.meaning: (informal) A usually wet sucking or slurping sound.
examples: Today the water made a schloop sound as it lapped up the beach, sounding a very distant cousin to the raging surf on a stormy day.

verbs.description: schloop (third-person singular simple present schloops, present participle schlooping, simple past and past participle schlooped)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive, informal) To move, or cause to move, in a wet, gooey manner.
(intransitive, informal) To make a usually wet sucking or slurping sound.
